posts.title: About this Page
posts.author: Jeah Kim
posts.authorRole: Contributing author exploring the intersections of science, technology, and art.
posts.excerpt: Illustrate scientific discoveries in a fabulous way
posts.lead: A quick tour of why Intersections exists and how stories come together across biomedicine, technology, and art.
content: Intersections is a magazine-style personal site that curates work and writing across three domains…
Each post balances clarity and craft — visuals serve the science, not the other way around…
Expect process write-ups, working documents, and essays on design decisions that shape outcomes.

posts.title: Learning Unity
posts.author: Jeah Kim
posts.authorRole: Interactive XR designer and biomedical communicator.
posts.lead: Head-bobbing locomotion experiments on Pico Neo 3…
content: This article documents the locomotion prototype built around head bobbing…
We tuned stride detection thresholds, smoothed velocity, and aligned camera bob with step cadence…
What worked: simple signal processing and short feedback loops. What didn’t: overfitting to a single headset.

posts.title: AMI 2025: Reflection
posts.author: Jeah Kim
posts.excerpt: Molecular visualization workshop, Student showcase, and talks
posts.lead: Notes from workshops, showcases, and talks — where molecular visualization met storytelling.
content: The student showcase highlighted narrative clarity over technical complexity…
Workshops emphasized pipeline pragmatism: iterate in low-fidelity, commit late to polish…
Key takeaway: treat accuracy and aesthetics as partners, not tradeoffs.
